name: ITP004D – Asphalt Production (Type H Shoulder Mix)
template name: ITP004D – Asphalt Production (Type H Shoulder Mix)

name: Acceptance Criteria - The production plan must demonstrate that the production capacity and the hot storage capacity of the mixing plant is sufficient to supply asphalt to complete the work undertaken within any work period on time.
Reference Documents - AECOM – MAPMP 2.0 DP1 Spec. Cl 14.13.15.1
Record of conformity - Aconex Corresponde nce
Responsibility - FH Project Engineer / Contract Administrator / Principal’s Design Consultant
1.2 - Checking of Weighting Devices and Certificates
Acceptance Criteria - The Contractor must supply details of current certification of weighing equipment including belt weighers and weighbridges to the Contract Administrator.
Reference Documents - AECOM – MAPMP 2.0 DP1 Spec. Cl 14.13.15.6
Record of conformity - Aconex Corresponde nce
Responsibility - FH Project Engineer / Contract Administrator / Principal’s Design Consultant

Acceptance Criteria - Calibrating all necessary devices and parameters at the mixing plant to achieve the “Job Mix”. Established plants must provide historical records of the asphalt production over the previous one (1) month to verify consistency.
Reference Documents - AECOM – MAPMP 2.0 DP1 Spec. Cl 14.13.15.11
Record of conformity - Historical records of asphalt production, This ITP signed
Responsibility - FH Project Engineer / Contract Administrator / Principal’s Design Consultant
1.4 - Submission and review of mix design
Acceptance Criteria - Submission and review of a mix design report detailing the mix which meets the requirements of the specification.
Reference Documents - AECOM – MAPMP 2.0 DP1 Spec. Cl 14.11.4
Record of conformity - Aconex Corresponde nce
Responsibility - FH Project Engineer / Contract Administrator / Principal’s Design Consultant
2. Asphalt Production – Type H Shoulder Mix
Frequency - Every loaded truck or at intervals of 15 minutes if more than one truck is dispatched in 15 minutes.
Record of conformity - Load inspection sheet / docket
Frequency - One test per 250 tonnes (or part thereof) if lot is >40 tonnes
Record of conformity - Load inspection sheet / test report
2.3 - Visual inspection for segregation, uncoated particles, separated binder, excess binder or overheating
Acceptance Criteria - >95% coarse aggregate coated with binder, no obvious separated binder or uncoated particles
Record of conformity - Load inspection sheet
2.4 - Visual inspection for segregation, uncoated particles, separated binder, excess binder or overheating
Frequency - One test per 250 tonnes (or part thereof) if lot is >40 tonnes
Acceptance Criteria - >95% coarse aggregate coated with binder, no obvious separated binder or uncoated particles
Record of conformity - Load inspection sheet
Acceptance Criteria - ± 35 kg/m3 of its 6-point rolling average
Record of conformity - NATA - accredited test certificate
Frequency - One test per 250 tonnes (or part thereof) if lot is >40 tonnes
Acceptance Criteria - ±0.3% of mix design specification
Inspection / Test Method - AS2891.3.3 or AGPT/T234
Record of conformity - NATA - accredited test certificate
Frequency - One test per 250 tonnes (or part thereof) if lot is >40 tonnes
Acceptance Criteria - See Table 1 Table 1 of this document.
Table 1: Production tolerances for mix grading (Table 407.101 in DoT Section 407)
1. If post compaction grading is checked by binder extraction and sieve analysis after placement, the positive tolerances shall be increased by one percentage point.
Sieve size AS (mm) || Tolerance on percentage passing (by mass)
Sieve size AS (mm) || Size 7 || Size 10 || Size 14 || Size 20
Inspection / Test Method - AS2891.3.3 or AGPT/T234
Record of conformity - NATA - accredited test certificate
Frequency - One test per 250 tonnes (or part thereof) if lot is >40 tonnes
Record of conformity - NATA - accredited test certificate
3. RAP Testing - RAP Level 1 and 2 (as per Table 407.121 Section 407)

(1) An approved RAP management plan addressing RAP stockpile management, RAP sampling and testing, RAP process control, RAP traceability, RAP binder blend viscosity (RAP Level 2) and asphalt plant capability shall be submitted to DoT at least 14 days prior to the asphalt works. No asphalt containing RAP shall be supplied until DoT approves the management plant.
Frequency - One test per 500 tonnes of RAP

Acceptance Criteria - Not exceeding the maximum moisture content acceptable for the asphalt plant nominated in the RAP Management Plan – Fulton Hogan Infrastructure Services. Any materials with moisture content greater than the nominated moisture content should be allowed to drain before being utilised.
Reference Documents - Section 407.13(c) FH RAP Managemen t Plan Section 3.2
Record of conformity - NATA - accredited test certificate
Responsibility - Laboratory Technician / RAP Yard Supervisor
Frequency - One test per 500 tonnes of RAP
Acceptance Criteria - ± 0.5 of target binder content, 1 out of 10 consecutive results is allowed outside tolerance
Record of conformity - NATA - accredited test certificate
Responsibility - Laboratory Technician / RAP Yard Supervisor
Frequency - One test per 500 tonnes of RAP
Acceptance Criteria - See Table 2 Table 2 of this document.
Table 2: RAP grading tolerances (Table 407.131 in DoT Section 407)
Description || Tolerance (from target grading) || Allowable number of results outside of tolerance
Passing 26.5 mm sieve and larger || ± 10 || 1 out of 5 consecutive results
Passing 4.75 mm to 19.0 mm sieve || ± 8 || 1 out of 5 consecutive results
Passing 1.18 mm and 2.36 mm || ± 6 || 1 out of 5 consecutive results
Passing 0.300 mm and 0.600 mm || ± 5 || 1 out of 5 consecutive results
Passing 0.150 mm || ± 3 || 1 out of 5 consecutive results
Passing 0.075 mm || ± 2 || 1 out of 10 consecutive results
Record of conformity - NATA - accredited test certificate
Responsibility - Laboratory Technician / RAP Yard Supervisor
4. RAP Testing - RAP Level 2 (as per Table 407.121 Section 407)

(1) An approved RAP management plan addressing RAP stockpile management, RAP sampling and testing, RAP process control, RAP traceability, RAP binder blend viscosity (RAP Level 2) and asphalt plant capability shall be submitted to DoT at least 14 days prior to the asphalt works. No asphalt containing RAP shall be supplied until DoT approves the management plant.
Frequency - One test per 1000 tonnes lot of RAP used for Level 2 mixes as per Table 407.121
Acceptance Criteria - Viscosity of the blend of virgin and RAP binder shall fall within the range in the table below:
Specified Binder Class || Binder Blend Viscosity Range (Pa.s @ 60°C)
Inspection / Test Method - AGPT/T192 or AS 2341.2, AGPT/T193
Record of conformity - NATA - accredited test certificate
